document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Harmothoe Kinberg, 1856 (Polychaeta: Polynoidae) in the Northeast Atlantic

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Harmothoe Kinberg, 1856 (Polychaeta: Polynoidae) in the Northeast Atlantic

bibRefCitation.author: Loshamn, A. A.
bibRefCitation.refString: Loshamn, A. A. (1981) Description of five polynoid species (Polychaeta) from the coasts of Norway and Sweden, including three new species, one new genus and one new generic name. Zoologica Scripta, 10, 5 - 13.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material. Harmothoe viridis
:
holotype (af), SMNH-Type-3171, Sweden , Bohuslän , Säcken , reef,
3 April 1974
, leg. L. Almkvist.

Additional material .
NE Atlantic : 1 spm., SMF 17276 , "Johan Ruud" St. 734, 69°52.04’N , 18°52.82’E , N Norway , Kvalsund i Kårvik ,
07 October 2002
, epibenthic sledge,
60 m
, leg. & ded. C. d’Udekem d’Acoz
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 32.
Harmothoe vesiculosa
(additional specimen, SMF 16991). (A) anterior end; styles of median antenna, right dorsal tentacular cirrus, and left dorsal cirrus missing; (B) left anterior elytron from unknown segment; (C) detail of posterior margin of same; (D) left cirrigerous parapodium from segment 16, posterior view, style of dorsal cirrus missing; (E) distal part of long notochaeta; (F) tip of same; (G) distal part of middle neurochaeta; (H) tip of same; (I) tip of upper neurochaeta; (J) tip of lower neurochaeta. (Scale: A, B = 2 mm; C, E, G = 250 µm; D = 1 mm; F, H–J = 100 µm).

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis . Anterior pair of eyes dorsolateral at widest part of prostomium. Elytral margin papillate; surface covered by conical microtubercles and few scattered papillae. Neuropodia with short, digitiform supra-acicular process.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 33.
Harmothoe viridis
(holotype, SMNH-Type-3171). (A) anterior end; left palp bent downwards, right palp missing, styles of right dorsal tentacular cirrus and left dorsal cirrus missing; (B) right anterior elytron from unknown segment, free in vial; (C) detail of posterior margin of same; (D) left cirrigerous parapodium from segment 14, posterior view, style of dorsal cirrus missing; (E) long notochaeta; (F) tip of same; (G) middle neurochaeta; (H) tip of same; (I) tip of lower neurochaeta. (Scales: A, B = 2 mm; C, F, H, I = 100 µm; E, G = 250 µm).

Bylgides
or
Eunoe
Description (based on holotype (af), except for number of elytra and segments, cf. Loshamn 1981 ).

Tentaculophores inserted laterally to prostomium, each with two notochaetae and a dorsal and ventral tentacular cirrus, styles of cirri papillate, tapering. Second segment with first pair of elytra, biramous parapodia, and long buccal cirri. Following segments with tapering, short ventral cirri.

caption.paragraph: TABLE 3. Species referred to other genera.

original name:
Polynoe zonata Langerhans, 1880
Colour in life greenish, in ethanol pigmentation more or less faded.
Measurements . Holotype (af), SMNH-Type-3171 ( Fig. 33A–I ): L 16 mm , W 7 mm for 18 segments; paratypes (cf. Loshamn 1981 ): L 8–38 mm , W 2–8 mm for 38 for 41 segments.
Distribution. Northeast Atlantic, along the Norwegian coast to the Skagerrak.
Habitat . On various hard and soft bottoms, in 30 to 120 m .
